oai_dc:dc.dc:title: US Model 1842 musket dated 1847 with bayonet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The model 1842 US musket was the first general issue weapon designed to use percussion caps. It was also the last smoothbore weapon made for issue to front-line infantry units. This model was made in 1847 and included in the photograph is the bayonet. The model 1842 was widely available in the early days of the war and were used by both sides until replaced by more advanced weapons with rifled bores. The cotton canvas sling is a modern reproduction.
